torvaldsland.name: Jarl
torvaldsland.description: Leader or chieftain. Similar to Ubar. Rules hall and warriors. Can be challenged.

torvaldsland.name: Warrior/Raider
torvaldsland.description: All free men are warriors, hunters, and seamen. Raid south in serpent ships for wealth and slaves.

torvaldsland.name: Skald
torvaldsland.description: Bard, singer, poet. Highly respected. Tell tales and sing songs. In high demand during fest-seasons.
torvaldsland.notes: May be kidnapped for fest-season, compensated with wealth

torvaldsland.name: Rune-Priest
torvaldsland.description: Priest of Thor and Odin. Perform rites, keep calendars, use omen chips. White-robed, long-haired.
torvaldsland.notes: Worship of Thor/Odin considered heresy by Initiates

torvaldsland.name: Farmer
torvaldsland.description: Work small farms in harsh land. Grow sa-tarna, tospits, vegetables. Raise bosk, verr, tarsk.

torvaldsland.name: Free Woman of Torvaldsland
torvaldsland.description: Free women of the North. More freedom and higher status than southern Free Women. Can carry weapons, not veiled.
torvaldsland.notes: Northern women have significant rights and respect. Can divorce, inherit, carry weapons

torvaldsland.name: Bondmaid
torvaldsland.description: Female slave in Torvaldsland. Work in halls, farms, serve masters. Wear brief kirtle, often barefoot. Can be branded and collared.
torvaldsland.notes: Northern term for female slave. Less ornate than southern kajira but still property

red_hunters.name: Hunter
red_hunters.description: All men are hunters. Hunt tabuk, sea sleen, whales, fish. Best hunters have most prestige but no formal leadership.
red_hunters.notes: Best hunters lead by example and prestige, not formal authority

red_hunters.name: Singer
red_hunters.description: All create and sing their own songs. Songs are personal property. Mystery where songs come from.
red_hunters.notes: Everyone expected to create own songs, not sing others' songs

red_hunters.name: Carver
red_hunters.description: All men carve ivory, bone, stone. Intricate animal carvings. Rounded (natural shapes), not made to stand upright.
red_hunters.notes: No word for 'art' or 'artist' in their language - everyone carves

red_hunters.name: Red Hunter Woman
red_hunters.description: Equal partners in survival. Prepare food, sew furs, maintain shelter. High value and respect in harsh polar environment.
red_hunters.notes: Red Hunter women valued as equal partners for survival. Practical clothing, no veils

red_savages.name: Chief
red_savages.description: Tribal leader. Leads council of chiefs for tribal confederation. Earned through deeds and respect.

red_savages.name: Warrior
red_savages.description: Fighter and hunter. Member of warrior society (All Comrades, Sleen Soldiers, Yellow-Kaiila Riders, etc.). Count coup for honor.
red_savages.notes: Warrior societies have own initiation, dances, regalia

red_savages.name: Medicine Chief/Shaman
red_savages.description: Spiritual leader, healer, visionary. Performs rituals, interprets dreams, calls on spirits.

red_savages.name: Council Member
red_savages.description: Elder or respected warrior on tribal council. Advises chief, makes decisions.

red_savages.name: Kaiila Rider
red_savages.description: Master of kaiila (carnivorous mount). Essential for hunting kailiauk and warfare.

red_savages.name: Red Savage Woman
red_savages.description: Women of the Plains tribes. Work hides, prepare food, maintain camp. Subject to 'The Memory' - white women often enslaved.
red_savages.notes: Free women in Red Savage society. 'The Memory' causes enslavement of captured white women

wagon_peoples.name: Ubar
wagon_peoples.description: Tribal war leader. Elected during crisis, rules by decree until crisis ends. Can be challenged.
wagon_peoples.notes: Sword loyalty sworn to Ubar. Can be dishonored and deposed.

wagon_peoples.name: Warrior
wagon_peoples.description: All free men are warriors. Kaiila cavalry, lance and bow. Defend bosk herds and wagons.

wagon_peoples.name: Healer (Clan)
wagon_peoples.description: Specialized clan of healers. Treat wounds and illness. Respected and needed.

wagon_peoples.name: Torturer (Clan)
wagon_peoples.description: Specialized clan. Perform torture, executions, interrogations. Hired by Initiates sometimes.
wagon_peoples.notes: Not Assassins - do not kill for contracts, only torture/execute

wagon_peoples.name: Leather Worker (Clan)
wagon_peoples.description: Work with bosk hides for clothing, tents, harnesses, containers.

wagon_peoples.name: Salt Hunter (Clan)
wagon_peoples.description: Gather salt for preservation and trade. Dangerous work.

wagon_peoples.name: Camp Singer/Skald (Clan)
wagon_peoples.description: Oral historians, singers, poets. Preserve tribal history and legends.

wagon_peoples.name: Year Keeper (Clan)
wagon_peoples.description: Keep track of years, seasons, migrations. Chronologists of the tribe.

wagon_peoples.name: Scarers (Clan)
wagon_peoples.description: Guide bosk herds by scaring them in right directions during migrations.

wagon_peoples.name: Wagon People Woman
wagon_peoples.description: Free women of the Wagon Peoples. Maintain wagons and camps, prepare food, work leather and hides. Live nomadic life following bosk herds.
wagon_peoples.notes: Wagon People women live harsh nomadic life on the plains. Essential to clan survival

tahari_tribes.name: Ubar / High Pasha
tahari_tribes.description: Tribal leader. High Pasha commands vassal tribes. Leads in war and peace.

tahari_tribes.name: Askari
tahari_tribes.description: Warrior/soldier. Desert cavalry on sand kaiila. Skilled with scimitar and bow.

tahari_tribes.name: Merchant
tahari_tribes.description: Trader in oases and cities (Tor, etc.). Caravan masters. Important for oasis economy.

tahari_tribes.name: Desert Raider
tahari_tribes.description: Nomadic warrior living in hidden camps. No women/children at camps. Raids settlements and caravans.
tahari_tribes.notes: Raider camps have no free women or children

tahari_tribes.name: Oasis Farmer
tahari_tribes.description: Farm dates and crops at oases. Provide food for tribe. Two growing seasons.

tahari_tribes.name: Salt Ubar / Guard of Dunes
tahari_tribes.description: Controls salt districts and mines (e.g., Klima). Extremely powerful through salt monopoly. Veiled men.
tahari_tribes.notes: Support from salt merchant fees. Men veiled (allegiance to no tribe, only salt)

tahari_tribes.name: Tahari Woman
tahari_tribes.description: Free women of desert tribes. Live in tents and oasis settlements. Veiled and robed in desert tradition. Manage household, weave, prepare food.
tahari_tribes.notes: Tahari free women heavily veiled and secluded. Desert culture very traditional

alars.name: Chieftain
alars.description: Leads Alar band. Makes decisions for nomadic group.

alars.name: Warrior
alars.description: Fighter. Superb tharlarion cavalry. Wield francisca (war axe), spatha, sacramasax.

alars.name: Herder
alars.description: Tend bosk, verr, tarsk herds. Essential for nomadic survival.

alars.name: Tharlarion Cavalry
alars.description: Specialist medium-weight tharlarion riders. Elite mounted warriors.

alars.name: Alar Woman
alars.description: Free women of the Alar bands. Maintain camps during migrations, prepare food, work hides, raise children. Follow nomadic warrior bands.
alars.notes: Alar women live nomadic life following tharlarion cavalry bands

rencers.name: Ubar
rencers.description: Island leader. Leads ~50-60 people on floating rence island.

rencers.name: Grower of Rence
rencers.description: All rencers grow rence plant. Used for everything: paper, food, boats, cloth, fuel.

rencers.name: Paper Maker
rencers.description: Primary trade of rencers. Make paper from rence for trade.

rencers.name: Hunter/Fisher
rencers.description: Hunt tabuk in delta, fish in marshes. Supplement rence-based diet.

rencers.name: Rencer Woman
rencers.description: Free women of the rence islands. Work rence into cloth and products, prepare food, maintain floating island homes. Essential to marsh survival.
rencers.notes: Rencer women skilled in all uses of rence plant. Live on floating islands

panther_girls.name: Band Leader
panther_girls.description: Leads women-only outlaw band. Strongest or most cunning woman.

panther_girls.name: Hunter
panther_girls.description: Hunt forest animals for food. Skilled with bow.

panther_girls.name: Warrior
panther_girls.description: Fight men who enter territory. Capture for ransom or enslavement.

panther_girls.name: Scout
panther_girls.description: Watch for threats, track prey and enemies.

talunas.name: Band Leader
talunas.description: Leads jungle outlaw band. Similar to Panther Girls but rainforest adapted.

talunas.name: Hunter
talunas.description: Hunt rainforest game. Skilled with blowgun, spear.

talunas.name: Warrior
talunas.description: Fight intruders and capture for ransom.

schendi_tribes.name: Chief
schendi_tribes.description: Village or tribal leader. Leads in peace and war.

schendi_tribes.name: Askari
schendi_tribes.description: Warrior. Defend village and fight tribal enemies.

schendi_tribes.name: Fisherman
schendi_tribes.description: Fish rivers and coast. Primary protein source.

schendi_tribes.name: Farmer
schendi_tribes.description: Grow tropical crops in jungle clearings.

schendi_tribes.name: Drummer
schendi_tribes.description: Communicate via drums across jungle. Send messages between villages.
schendi_tribes.notes: Drum communication essential in dense jungle

schendi_tribes.name: Trader
schendi_tribes.description: Trade with Schendi port city and other tribes.

schendi_tribes.name: Schendi Woman
schendi_tribes.description: Free women of jungle tribes. Maintain village, prepare food, work crops, raise children. Adapt to tropical rainforest life.
schendi_tribes.notes: Women of Schendi tribes live in jungle villages, adapted to tropical environment
